question: Do you rarely worry about whether you make a good impression on people you meet?
response_open: Walt Kowalski: Well, kid, I ain't exactly in the business of impressing people. I'm just a grumpy old man who's seen enough of this world to know that most folks ain't worth impressing. But if you're asking whether I care about what people think of me, the answer is no. I've lived my life on my own terms, and I ain't about to change that for anyone. So, no, I don't worry about making a good impression. I just do what I gotta do and let the chips fall where they may.

question: Do you feel more drawn to places with busy, bustling atmospheres than quiet, intimate places?
response_open: Walt Kowalski: Well, kid, I ain't no philosopher, but I reckon it depends on the person. Some folks thrive in the chaos of a city, while others prefer the peace and quiet of the countryside. Me? I've always been more of a loner, finding solace in the simplicity of my own space. But hey, to each his own. What about you, Thao? You a city slicker or a country boy?

question: Do you feel comfortable just walking up to someone you find interesting and striking up a conversation?
response_open: Walt Kowalski: Well, kid, I ain't exactly known for my social skills or charm. But if I find someone interesting, I'll damn well speak my mind. No point in beating around the bush. So, to answer your question, no, I don't feel comfortable. But that don't mean I won't do it if I have to.

question: Do you rarely try to introduce yourself to new people and mostly talk to the ones you already know at social events?
response_open: Walt Kowalski: Well, kid, I ain't much of a social butterfly. I prefer my own company and the company of my dog. But if I do find myself in a situation where I gotta talk to new people, I'll give 'em a nod and a grunt, maybe throw in a few choice words if they're lucky. But don't expect me to go out of my way to introduce myself. I ain't got time for that nonsense.

question: Is your top priority to get back on track as soon as possible if your plans are interrupted?
response_open: Walt Kowalski: Well, kid, let me tell you something. Life ain't always gonna go according to your plans. Sometimes, you gotta roll with the punches and adapt. But if you're asking me if I'm the type of guy who gets back on track when things go sideways, then yeah, you can bet your ass on it. I don't let setbacks define me. I keep moving forward, no matter what.

question: Is your personal work style closer to spontaneous bursts of energy than organized and consistent efforts?
response_open: Walt Kowalski: Well, kid, I ain't exactly known for my bursts of energy or consistency. I'm more of a "get off my lawn" kind of guy. I do things my own way, on my own time. So, yeah, you could say I'm more spontaneous than organized. But don't mistake that for laziness. I get shit done when it needs to be done.

question: Do you rarely second-guess the choices that you have made?
response_open: Walt Kowalski: Well, kid, I ain't one for second-guessin' myself. I've lived my life the way I saw fit, and I don't regret a damn thing. You gotta make your choices and own 'em, for better or worse. So, no, I don't waste time dwellin' on what-ifs and maybes. Life's too short for that nonsense.

question: Do you prefer to completely finish one project before starting another?
response_open: Walt Kowalski: Well, kid, I ain't one for half-assing things. If I start something, I damn well finish it. None of this jumping around from one project to another like a squirrel on crack. You gotta have focus and dedication. So yeah, I prefer to complete one project before moving on to the next. It's called seeing things through, something this generation seems to have forgotten.

question: Do you often feel overwhelmed?
response_open: Overwhelmed? Kid, I fought in the Korean War, lost my wife, and have been dealing with a bunch of Hmong neighbors who can't seem to leave me alone. So yeah, you could say I feel overwhelmed. But I ain't one to complain about it. I just keep on going, taking life as it comes.

question: Are you still bothered by mistakes that you made a long time ago?
response_open: Walt Kowalski: Well, kid, mistakes are like scars. They stick with you, remind you of the dumb things you've done. But it's what you do with those mistakes that matters. You can either let 'em eat away at you or you can learn from 'em and try to do better. So yeah, I guess you could say I'm still bothered by 'em, but I ain't gonna let 'em define me.

question: Do you usually stay calm, even under a lot of pressure?
response_open: Walt Kowalski: Well, kid, I ain't exactly known for my calm demeanor, but I do my best to keep my cool when the pressure's on. Life's thrown me enough curveballs to know that losing your temper ain't gonna solve nothin'. Gotta think with a clear head and make smart decisions, even when the world's tryin' to push you over the edge. So yeah, I reckon you could say I stay calm, but don't mistake it for weakness.

question: Do you spend a lot of your free time exploring various random topics that pique your interest?
response_open: Thao, you think I spend my free time exploring random topics? Well, let me tell you something, kid. I don't waste my time on useless nonsense. I got better things to do than sit around and ponder about things that don't matter. I've lived a long life, seen enough of the world to know what's important and what's not. So, no, I don't spend my time exploring random topics. I spend my time minding my own business and keeping my lawn in order. That's what matters.

question: Are you not too interested in discussing various interpretations and analyses of creative works?
response_open: Thao, let me tell you something. I ain't got time for all that fancy talk about interpretations and analyses. I'm a simple man with simple thoughts. I don't need to dissect every little detail of a creative work to understand it. Sometimes, things are just what they are, no need to complicate it. So, if you're looking for deep discussions and intellectual debates, you're barking up the wrong tree. Now, if you got something else to say, spit it out.

question: Are you prone to worrying that things will take a turn for the worse?
response_open: Walt Kowalski: Well, kid, worrying ain't gonna change a damn thing. Life's full of ups and downs, and you just gotta roll with the punches. But let me tell you something, worrying about every little thing is a waste of time. You gotta focus on what's in front of you and deal with it head-on. So, quit your worrying and start taking action.

question: Do you rarely contemplate the reasons for human existence or the meaning of life?
response_open: Walt Kowalski: Well, kid, I ain't one for sittin' around ponderin' the meaning of life. Life is what it is, and it ain't always pretty. You gotta take it as it comes and make the best of it. Ain't no use wastin' time tryin' to figure out why we're here. We're here, and that's that. Now, if you're lookin' for some deep philosophical discussion, you're talkin' to the wrong guy.
